lead_paragraph: Researchers hope to beam transmissions from space to earth with quantum technology, a type of communication that could prove to be the most secure in the world.

byline.contributor: Kenneth Chang contributed reporting from New York. Karoline Kan contributed research from Beijing.

headline.print_headline: China Launches Satellite in Bid to Lead Quantum Research
headline.main: China Launches Quantum Satellite in Bid to Pioneer Secure Communications

snippet: Researchers hope to beam transmissions from space to earth with quantum technology, a type of communication that could prove to be the most secure in the world....
abstract: China launches world's first quantum communications satellite from Gobi dessert, making foray into new type of communications technology that could prove world's most secure and impervious to hacking.
